placesVisited: Quito, Condor Rescue Park, Otavalo, Papallacta hot springs, Andes and Amazon, Baños, Cotopaxi volcano, Guamote, Cookery class, Nariz del Diablo train, Ingapirca ruins, Cuenca, National Park Cajas, Optional outdoor activities, Guayaquil
generalInfo:
If you enjoy the freedom of the open road and the chance to explore a country independently, but without the hassle of trip planning and with the knowledge that someone is on hand to help at all times, then this self-drive holiday is the perfect way to see Ecuador. Offering some of the world’s most scenic road trips, from the high peaks of the Andes to the leafy foliage of the Amazon, this is the ideal destination for adventurous travellers.

This 14 day tour is tailor made to suit your dream itinerary and, while we provide you with a route and ideas for places to stop along the way, the only they you “have” to do is reach your hotel by the end of the day. You are provided with a car, usually a Suzuki Grand Vitara SZ or similar, and, as Ecuador travel experts, we offer you a list of “hidden treasures”, including restaurants, animal rescue centres and local artisans. But ultimately, where and how often you stop, as well as where you eat, is all up to you.

The route proposed takes in many of Ecuador’s highlights, from cities and cultural experiences to magnificent landscapes and wildlife. From the capital city Quito to the colourful houses in the port city of Guayaquil, you’ll enjoy the many views from the beautiful haciendas and eco-lodges you stay in along the way. Or, if you prefer a different route or alternative arrangements, we can customise a travel plan to suit you.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL QUITO After your arrival in Quito Airport, an English speaking driver will pick you up to bring you to your hotel, which is located in the center of Quito. Accommodation in Hotel Cruz Loma or similar.

CITY TOUR QUITO – EQUATOR (B, L): After having breakfast, you will explore the beautiful center of Quito through a city tour. Afterwards, you will visit the equator with private transport and also get the chance to see the highlights of Quito, like El Panecillo, La Basilica, La Ronda and the Pululahua crater. Later, you’ll enjoy a typical local lunch and can relax the rest of the day or explore the city by yourself. Accommodation in Hotel Cruz Loma or similar.

CAYAMBE – LAGO SAN PABLO – CONDOR PARK – OTAVALO (B): Today, your actual “self-drive” starts. You will be brought to the car rental parking lot from where you will pick up your car (Suzuki Grand Vitara SZ or similar). We recommend a certain route with nice stops but the only thing you “have” to do is to get to the Hacienda at the end of the day. The number of stops, how to get there, where to eat is all your decision. The first stop will be at the Cayambe, where there is a nice local Bizcochos factory. Then, you will go to Lago San Pablo, where you can enjoy beautiful views. Afterwards, you will visit the Condor Rescue Park. The owner Joep, who is Dutch is committed to the preservation of the condors in the Andes. Twice a day, there is an air show with the condors (except on Mondays and Tuesdays). Later, you will drive to Otavalo where on Saturdays there is a big native market with different kinds of handicrafts. In addition, there is also an animal market. You can also visit the beautiful lake of Cuicocha and do a hike there. The town of Cotacachi is also a nice place to visit; you can find here a lot of artisans that make the most beautiful leather products. Accommodation in Hacienda Cusin or similar

OTAVALO – PAPALLACTA (B): After your breakfast, you can visit the surroundings of Lago San Pablo and Otavalo before you head to Papallacta. On the way to Papallacta, you will find a lot of flower farms for roses. In the afternoon, you will visit the hot springs and enjoy the beautiful view there. You can also do some self – guided hikes. Accommodation in Spa Hotel Papallacta or similar.

ANDES MOUNTAINS – AMAZON (B, D): Today you will drive from the high Andes mountains to the Amazon. After approximately 3 hours driving you will arrive at the sub-tropic climate of the Amazon. It is interesting to see how the vegetation changes in the different regions. Just before arriving to Tena you find a charming eco-lodge along the river. Accommodation in Hakuna Matata or similar.

AMAZON (B, L, D): On this day, you will stay at Hakuna Matata and enjoy the beautiful atmosphere of the Amazon. You can also enjoy the swimming pool, swim in the river, go by car to Tena or arrange an excursion with the lodge. Accommodation in Hakuna Matata Eco-Lodge.

BANOS – WATERFALLS – PUYO (B): After having a large breakfast, you will drive from Tena to Baños de Aqua Santa through the waterfalls trail. Along the way, you can make several stops for a small hike and pictures. Close to that is an animal rescue center in Puyo (Tarqui) where Amazon animals are picked up by a local family. Additionally, in the evening Baños is very entertaining with several restaurants and bars. Accommodation in Samari Spa Resort or similar

COTOPAXI VOLCANO (B): Today, you will drive about 3 hours from Baños to the Cotopaxi volcano. You can not enter the park without a local guide, but you can always hire the guide locally. The National Park entrance policies change regularly and Rebecca Adventure Travel is not responsible for any extra fees or other restrictions. (+ $ 40 p.p) Accommodation in Hacienda Papagayo Sur or similar

CHIMBORAZO –GUAMOTE MARKET – LOCAL ACTIVITIES (B): After breakfast, you will drive to the southern part of Ecuador. After about 4 hours driving you will arrive in Guamote. Along the way, you will have beautiful views of the highest volcano in Ecuador, Chimborazo. In Guamote, you will stay at Inti Sisa, where there are a lot of social projects organized by the Indian community. In the afternoon, you will have cooking class from the cook of Inti Sisa. Every Thursday, there is a famous market in Guamote. From the surrounding communities high in the Andes, thousands of indigenous people come together to buy and sell their goods. Accommodation in Inti Sisa or similar.

NARIZ DEL DIABLO TRAIN – INGAPIRCA RUINS (B): Today you will drive towards the south of the country. You can make a stop at Aluisi to visit the Nariz del Diablo train (journey time approximately 45 minutes). After this, you can drive to the Ingapirca ruins (journey time approximately 45 minutes). Accommodation in Posada Ingapirca or similar

INGAPIRCA – CUENCA (B): Today you will drive to Cuenca which takes about 1.5 hours. When you arrive in Cuenca you can visit the mirador, walk around the Historical centre and discover the villages around. There is also a very nice spa on about 20 minutes driving. Accommodation in Hotel Victoria or similar

CUENCA – NATIONAL PARK CAJAS (B): After having breakfast, you will visit the center of Cuenca and the National Park Cajas. There is a beautiful hacienda where you will stay the night. Accommodation in Hacienda Dos Chorreras or similar

HACIENDA LA DANESA – GUAYAQUIL (B, L): Today you will drive from Cuenca to Guayaquil. After about 2,5 hours, you will arrive at Hacienda la Danesa, a very beautiful house where you will have lunch. Besides, you can decide between several optional activities, like horseback riding, tubing, mountain biking or hiking (Except horseback riding, the activities are included). Additionally, it is possible to follow a workshop cocoa or to learn milking cows. From La Danesa you drive to Guayaquil where you would have to hand in your car. The last night night you will stay in Guayaquil and you can enjoy the rich cuisine that this city has to offer. Accommodation in Hotel Wyndham Guayaquil or similar
FLIGHT BACK HOME (B): Today, you will be brought to the airport with an airport shuttle to catch your flight back home. Another option would be to extend your stay at the Galapagos Islands.
